title.rendered: Our favourite Christmas inspired paint tones

content.rendered: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Our favourite Christmas inspired paint tones” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas, and our painter and decorators are here to help you make that happen with our preferred segment ‘Our favourite colours and tone’. This time we are exploring our favourite Christmas inspired paint tones, allowing you the opportunity to feel a bit more festive with your interior space. Complete a painting and decorating interior project in your London property through renovating your walls, kitchen cabinetry, or dedicating a specific area for an elegant Christmas now. Let us go all out this year![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Traditional Green: Duck Green” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”6870″][vc_column_text]Farrow & Ball[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1606391385699{padding-top: 20px !important;}”]From the Colour by Nature palette, we have selected a true colour of nature and of course, the traditional scheme for the Christmas occasion. Duck Green is that beautifully rich but subtle tone which genuinely works well in anything. Our painters and decorators would love to see this particular shade in kitchen cabinetry to create a modern yet elegant look and aesthetic. When decorating, this tone works particularly well with warmer shades such as deep browns and bronze accents. If you are going for a green shade as your choice, this is the perfect tone for you.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Rich Red: Show Stopper” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”6871″][vc_column_text]Sherwin Williams[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1606391491271{padding-top: 20px !important;}”]Another classic shade which we love and see for Christmas, red! The shade Show Stopper by Sherwin Williams is a beautiful creamy red, which looks delicious as a statement wall within your living room, or wherever your tree is located. This colour tone will emphasise your Christmas tree and its beautiful decorations, creating the perfect contrast to your preferred traditional scheme. This red tone stands out specifically to our painters and decorators as it is slightly muted, yet creates that utmost comfort that we are all yearning for this winter season. You may find many other red tones here to find the one which best fits your taste[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Winter Blue: Mazarine” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”6872″][vc_column_text]Little Greene[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Looking to bring Winter Wonderland into your home to replace the disappointment of not having it this year? Mazarine by Little Greene Paint Company is that atmospheric, yet moody blue which sets the perfect base for a winter blue and frosty colour scheme. If you are lacking ideas for the ideal Christmas colour scheme, make sure to visit our blog post in finding the perfect scheme for your home this Christmas! This blue shade will provide a luxurious and elegant tone within your living room or dining space.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Rustic Neutral: Pashmina” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”6873″][vc_column_text]Vivid Interior[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]If you are looking to create a warm, cosy and rustic environment to your London property this season, the beautiful Pashmina by Benjamin Moore is your tone. It makes a wonderful Christmas setting, especially when lit with ambient lighting, candlelight or the glow of a fireplace. This neutral shade works well with greener or darker accents when considering decorating. It also works in every aspect of the room, but we do love the tone for its comforting and welcoming purpose within a living room, reception or bedroom.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_custom_heading text=”Prominent Pink: Rhubarb” font_container=”tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%234c2c3d” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image=”6874″][vc_column_text]Paint and Paper Library[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Are you surprised to see a pink and dusty blush tone in this mix? You shouldn’t be as our painters and decorators have noted rising popularity with muted colours and pastels when it comes to the Christmas Holiday. This beautiful shade is called Rhubarb by Paint and Paper Library, which is a perfect name let us note! Use this shade with metallics such as gold and chrome. Our painting and decorating company guarantee this will be a complete and unique statement, especially in the dining space when feasting. Be adventurous with your decorating and find elegantly curved forms to enhance the beauty of this tone truly.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Looking to paint and renovate your home just before Christmas? The Good Painter is still available and working securely to transform dream homes and spaces into reality. Make sure to contact us now or request a quote by completing our online booking form![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

excerpt.rendered: It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas, and our painter and decorators are here to help you make that happen with our preferred segment ‘Our favourite colours and tone’.
